brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to investigate the pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamics metformin IR after oral
      administration in healthy elderly male volunteers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Metformin in the Elderly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males aged 65-85 years with a body mass index (BMI) of 18-28 kg/m2

          -  Good health based on complete medical history, physical examinations, vital signs,
             electrocardiography (ECG), and clinical laboratory evaluations including hematology
             (blood cell count, hemoglobin, and platelet count), liver function test (aspartate
             aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and bilirubin), serum
             creatinine, blood glucose and urinalysis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  If they had clinically relevant disorders

          -  Past history of diabetes or clinical findings to suspect diabetes

          -  Abnormal clinical laboratory values (i.e., platelets ≤ 75,000/mm3, hemoglobin ≤ 9
             g/dL, neutrophils absolute ≤ 1000/mm3, fasting glucose > 126mg/dL, creatinine ≥ 1.5
             mg/dL, or AST, ALT > 3 × upper limit of normal)

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Metformin in Elderly Healthy Male Volunteers

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Clinical Pharmacology and Therapeutics, Seoul National University Bundang hospital

oversight_info.authority: Korea: Ministry for Health, Welfare and Family Affairs

primary_outcome.description: AUC(area under the plasma concentration-time curve), Cmax(maximum plasma concentration), t1/2
primary_outcome.measure: AUC(area under the plasma concentration-time curve)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: AUG (total area under the serum concentration-time curve for glucose) Gmax(maximum serum glucose concentration)
secondary_outcome.measure: AUGC(total area under the serum concentration-time curve for glucose concentration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose and 15, 30, 45, 60, 90, 120 min oral glucose tolerance test

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
